_header: Almighty God father of heaven / For Christs love that died…
_description: Oracio deuota de Trinitate — five cross-rhymed quatrains

Bod789.First Lines:
Almiȝti god fader of heueneFor cristis loue þat deide on
                    rode…
Bod789.Last Lines:
…Al miȝti god of merci moostLord þu haue merci on
                    me
Bod789.Note: Four stanzas only, written as prose.
Bod789.Attributed Title: þis is an orisoun to þe holi trinite (f. 146)
Bod789.Editions:
Hirsh,  John C. 
             “Prayer and Meditation in Late Mediaeval England: MS. Bodley
                789.” 
             Medium Ævum
         48 (1979): 55-66: 59.

CULDd82.First Lines:
Almyghty god fader of heuenfor Cristes love that deyed yn
                    roode…
CULDd82.Last Lines:
…And that I may haue grace or þat I dayeRightfully to
                    Amende me
CULDd82.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Private Prayers in Middle English Verse.” 
             Studies in Philology
         36 (1939): 466-75: 472.
Person,  Henry Axel. 
             Cambridge Middle English Lyrics.
         Seattle: University of Washington Press, 1953; rev. ed. 1962: 2-3.

CULIi643.First Lines:
aLmyȝty god fadyr of heuenffor cristys loue þat dyed on
                    rode…
CULIi643.Last Lines:
…lorde haue mercy on meeAnd on all þat mercy nede for
                    charite
CULIi643.Note: Four quatrains (abab) and one five-line stanza (ababb).
CULIi643.Attributed Title: Oracio deuota de trinitate valde bona (f. 99v)
CULIi643.Editions:
Person,  Henry Axel. 
             Cambridge Middle English Lyrics.
         Seattle: University of Washington Press, 1953; rev. ed. 1962: 2.

BLHar2406.First Lines:
Almyghty god fadir of heueneFor cristis loue þat dyde on
                    rode…
BLHar2406.Last Lines:
…ffader and sone and holy gost and personys iijAlmyghty god of
                    myghtes most lord þou haue mercy on me
BLHar2406.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 79-80.
Davies,  Reginald Thorne. 
             Medieval English Lyrics: a critical anthology.
         London, 1963; Evanston, IL: Northwestern UP, 1964: 194.

Longleat29.First Lines:
Almyghty god fadyr of heuyne for cristes loue þat deied on
                    rodeI prey þe lord þou hyre my steuene & my delyte fulfulle
                    in goode…
Longleat29.Last Lines:
…ffadyr & son & holy gost Al one god persons threAl
                    myghty lord of mercy most lord Ihesu haue mercy on me
